page.title: 17BUS SERVICES IN SHIPSTON
page.content: In Shipston-on-Stour,14% of people interviewed used{public transport regularly.40% said that they rarely used public transport.50% used the local bus services. Shipston-on-Stour had been served by a{horse-drawn bus}from the mid-1800s. A motor bus service commenced in 1903. Services increased and reached their peak in the 1950s with 6 routes radiating from Shipston making a total of 76 journeys per week. Since that time,the{National Bus {Company}services have declined in number to 2 routes along the A34 (Birmingham,Stratford - Oxford), but the introduction of express buses has improved long-distance travel. { Barry's Coaches}of Moreton-in-Marsh operate 4 routes along minor roads to local villages and towns such as Banbury,Evesham and Moreton-in-Marsh.
